intro: Impatientella inaperta var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth impatient plant, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
